Judul: TALENT MANAGEMENT DEVELOPMENT AS A SUSTAINABLE COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE ( A CASE STUDY OF WINTEC)
Abstrak:
As an impact of Internet and communication technology advancement, any business organizations face a huge challenge in dealing with rapid changing business dynamics, where business competition based on product-feature innovation, or based on low-cost competition through operation excellence became obsolete and irrelevant, as it easily get copied by competitor in relatively short time. To face the challenge, organization need to play strategies that build sustainable competitive advantages to win not only in the short run, but also in the long run. One of the strategies is to align and to implement talent management system effectively.  
 

This case study was conducted to answer the questions whether Wintec implemented human resource management system based on the key principle of talent management system, which combined attraction, development, and retention factors in consistency and coherency with its business strategies. It also intended to find talent management system that is suitable with the existing business dynamics, not only to address WintecÃ‚Â’s high manpower turnover rate since major turnaround, but also to anticipate ASEAN Economic Community in the year of 2015 by building a sustainable competitive advantage. Employing mixed methods that combined quantitative and qualitative research method to collect data through questionnaire and face-to-face interview to all staff and manager level, it could be concluded that in general Wintec should develop compensation and reward management system that is tied to a fair and objective performance measurement system.
